humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report states that the left breast invasive ductal carcinoma measures 1.7 cm in greatest dimension. According to the rules provided, T1 tumors are 2 cm or less in size, and T2 tumors are more than 2 cm but not more than 5 cm. Therefore, the tumor in this report falls under the T1 category. Furthermore, the 'pT 1c N 0' notation in the synoptic report also indicates that the tumor is T1c, which means it is between 1.1 and 2 cm in size.

humanMachineDialogue.text: The T stage for breast cancer is determined by the size of the tumor. In this report, the left breast invasive ductal carcinoma measures 1.7 cm in greatest dimension (specimen C). According to the TNM staging system, a T1 stage is further divided into T1a (0.6 cm or less), T1b (more than 0.6 cm but not more than 1 cm), T1c (more than 1 cm but not more than 2 cm). Therefore, the T stage for this patient is T1c.
